title: Why Solid Perfumes Are the Ultimate Long-Lasting Fragrance Hack
description: Small but mighty picks from Diptyque, Fenty Beauty, Jo Malone, and more.
excerpt: Solid perfumes are slowly gaining traction in beauty, mainly because the concentrated formulas offer a long-lasting finish. Shop the eight best formulas ELLE editors and experts love.

html:
1

Best Spicy, Woody Perfume

Diptyque 34 Boulevard Saint Germain Refillable Solid Perfume

Cons
  • People note it leans more powdery than the actual candle

Displaying Diptyque candles in your home is guaranteed to spark conversation. Imagine the compliments you’ll receive when guests discover the gorgeous scent filling the air is actually the one kissing your pulse points. The balm combines sultry woods, spices, and florals to evoke the smell of Diptyque’s 34 Boulevard Saint-Germain store in Paris.

Key notes: amber, patchouli accord, rose, cinnamon, blackcurrant

Size: 0.11 fl oz

Nordstrom rating: 4.7/5 stars

Our expert says: “It’s a warm amber fragrance with spicy top notes of clove, cinnamon, and black currant. The heart notes of rose and geranium are rounded out with wood and eucalyptus base notes.”—Karl Neal, founder of Rebel Aromas

2

Best Skin Scents

NOYZ The Solid Fragrance Pair

Cons
  • Projection isn’t that strong

For those who love intimate, soft skin scents, Love Club and Unmute from Noyz are two great places to start. Bright florals and woods mark Love Club’s delicate scent, while Unmute takes a creamier twist with vanilla, cashmere, and pistachio.

Key notes: Love Club: Sichuan pepper, Italian mandarin, bergamot, Tuscan leather, Turkish pink rose, ebony woods, patchouli; Unmute: black plum, clary sage, pistachio, cashmere woods, Somalian incense base, Madagascar vanilla

Size: 0.24 fl oz

Ulta rating: 4.8/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Love Club eau de parfum was the first Noyz perfume I ever fell in love with, so the next step was to build out a stronger layering plan to make my favorite scent last all day. This perfume solid duo, which also features Unmute, is what I use first before topping it with the eau de parfum. With Unmute added to the mix, I’ve developed a soft, sexy signature scent so addicting I can’t stop sneaking whiffs throughout the day.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

3

Best Soft Musk Scent

Fenty Beauty by Rihanna Eau de Parfum Solid Perfume

Pros
  • Sexy, sophisticated scent
Cons
  • Can be too strong for some

We all wanted to smell like Rihanna, so she released the Fenty Eau de Parfum. If you already have the fragrance and wish to enhance its longevity, or you’re a Fenty newbie and want a clever way to sample it, this solid perfume takes the rosy, spicy notes of the original and refines them for everyday wear.

Key notes: magnolia, musk, Bulgarian rose

Size: 0.11 fl oz

An ELLE editor says: “Those who have the Fenty Eau de Parfum understand how bold and captivating it is, especially for nighttime wear. The solid version has a lighter, more versatile scent that’s just as alluring and sexy, but with a more second skin finish.”—Nerisha Penrose

4

Best Amber Scent

Glossier You Perfume Solid

Pros
  • Comforting, warm scent
Cons
  • Could last longer on skin

Few brands create skin scents as good as Glossier’s viral You perfume. Small enough to fit in your pocket or purse, a quick swivel unfurls a sweet caress of amber, musk, and pink pepper.

Key notes: ambrox, ambrette, musk, iris root, pink pepper

Size: 0.11 fl oz

Glossier rating: 3.7/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Before I got my hands on the You eau de parfum, my introduction to the beloved scent was through its solid perfume. I remember using it every day, applying it to all my pulse points regardless of what other perfume I opted for that day. The light, peppery scent melded seamlessly with all of my daily fragrances (I prefer layering two to three at a time). When used alone, my skin warms it up to unveil a sexy, skin-like scent that makes whatever clothes it rubs smell heavenly.”—Nerisha Penrose

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

5

Best Citrus Scent

Jo Malone Lime Basil & Mandarin Scent to Go

Pros
  • Bright, invigorating scent
Cons
  • Could last longer on skin

Lime, basil, and mandarin may sound like the perfect trio of tangy aromatics for a meal. In this composition, the luscious, zesty smells evoke images of sun-soaked beach days and boozy cocktails somewhere far away on the European coast.

Key notes: peppery basil, aromatic white thyme, lime

Size: 0.8 fl oz

Amazon rating: 5/5 stars

Our expert says: “Another one of my favorites, this one has a smooth, light texture and is a super fresh scent of citrus, peppery basil, and white thyme.”—Karl Neal

6

Best Floral Scent

Estée Lauder Hat Treat Solid Perfume Balm Compact

Pros
  • Scent not too overbearing
Cons
  • Can smell too sweet for some

A scent as sweet as its cake packaging, this perfume balm is fresh and bright, courtesy of delicate florals like lilies, white peonies, and jasmine. As it deepens, sandalwood and patchouli emerge to add a touch of sophistication central to the heritage beauty brand’s DNA.

Key notes: white lily, violet leaves, green accents, baie rose, jasmine, sandalwood, patchouli

Size: 0.01 fl oz

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

7

Best Floral Musk Scent

Derek Lam 10 Crosby Silent St Eau De Parfum

Pros
  • Initial projection is strong
Cons
  • Scent doesn’t last too long

Musks can sometimes lean heavy and sharp on the nose, which isn’t the most inviting. But Derek Lam’s Silent St. solid perfume softens the musks with airy, sweet florals for a calming, light scent.

Key notes: white musks, florals

Size: 0.12 fl oz

Amazon rating: 3.8/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “Love how this smells on me. I have been obsessed with solid perfumes lately and I am so happy to have found this one. It smells clean and light. I want the actual spray perfume or body mist too now.”

8

Best Spicy Gourmand

Lush Lord of Misrule

Cons
  • Herbaceous, earthy notes can be too strong for some

If you prefer your vanilla with a tinge of spice, Lord of Misrule is the gourmand scent to add to your collection. Sweet vanilla merges with patchouli and black pepper that opens with a spicy edge but settles into something sweeter and lighter for daily wear.

Key notes: black pepper, vanilla, patchouli

Size: 0.3 fl oz

Fragrantica rating: 4.3/5 stars

A Fragrantica reviewer says: “Wore this scent for a solid year and I absolutely loved it. It was comforting, enveloping but still delightfully clean and soapy.”

Meet the Experts

Does a solid or liquid perfume last longer?

Because solid perfumes are more concentrated, they’re formulated to last longer. “Solid perfumes are made with either a wax or oil base, which slows evaporation and helps lock the fragrance onto your skin. Liquid perfumes contain alcohol, which evaporates quickly, so although it creates a strong initial burst of fragrance, it tends to fade faster,” Neale explains.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

How should solid perfume be applied?

“Solid perfume formulas are also usually more concentrated and are designed to be applied to pulse points where they can warm up and release fragrance slowly throughout the day,” Neale says.

“Start with clean, moisturized skin,” he adds, as a clean base will ensure a full, accurate fragrance experience. “Then warm up the solid perfume with your fingers and apply to your pulse points—behind your ears, on your wrists, the inner elbows, and the back of your knees.”

Are there any disadvantages to using solid perfume?

The pros of using a solid perfume outweigh the cons. However, it’s important to note that solid perfumes “tend to take a little longer to apply since you need to rub them into the skin to warm up and can’t just spritz it on your clothes,” Neale shares.

Just as you’d research the ingredients in your skin care, you should understand what’s included in your perfume’s formula, especially “if you’re sensitive or allergic to ingredients like essential oils, beeswax or shea butter,” which many solids contain. “Hygiene is a factor to consider since you have to use your fingers to apply it and can potentially transfer dirt or bacteria into the container quite easily. Lastly, if you live in or are traveling to a hotter climate, they can, of course, melt and leak, which means they can be quite messy,” he says.
